description: Engage in a simplified gravity-defying aerial duel where height and timing determine the victor.
rationale: This game focuses on physics-based combat mechanics and momentum management. It targets players who enjoy classic arcade competition and provides a clear environment for AI agents to learn strategic positioning and reaction timing.
details: Vector Joust is a simplified version of classic aerial combat games. Two knights on winged mounts (represented by vector shapes) fly in a 2D arena. The core mechanic is 'Height Dominance': when two players collide, the one whose vertical position is higher wins the exchange. The arena features wrap-around screen edges (left to right). Gravity constantly pulls players down, requiring active flapping to maintain altitude. Collision with platforms or the ground results in a bounce, but being struck from above by an opponent results in a lost life.

technical_specs.physics: Constant gravity (g), upward thrust (impulse), horizontal inertia

how_to_stop: kill -9 $(pgrep -f main.py) or press ESC key
how_to_play: Goal: Gain the highest score by knocking out the opponent. Control your agent using the UP arrow key (flap) and LEFT/RIGHT arrow keys (horizontal movement). Scoring: +100 points for colliding with an opponent from a higher position. -50 points if hit from above. Game ends when a player loses 3 lives. AI agents should maximize vertical advantage before engaging in horizontal contact.
